lead_paragraph: MISSETT--Barbara Thatcher. 77 years old, died peacefully at her home in West Palm Beach, FL, on January 20, 2016, surrounded by her family. Barbara was born on May 25, 1938 in Washington, DC to Herbert and Virginia Thatcher. Barbara graduated from Rosemont College in Philadelphia in 1960 where she obtained her bachelor's degree in English. In 1980, she co-founded VIART Corporation, an art management firm based in New York City. During its twenty-nine years of operation VIART provided art advisory services to over 100 Fortune 500 companies, financial institutions, law firms, and private individuals including the acquisition of American, European, African and Asian art in all mediums and all periods. Barbara was a member of the Everglades Club in Palm Beach, FL, The Meadow Club of Southampton, and the Bathing Corporation of Southampton. Barbara was preceded in death by her parents and younger brother Denis Thatcher. Surviving are her sons Joseph Missett IV and Stephen Missett, her grandson Santiago Missett, and her siblings Judy O'Donnell, Sheila Taylor, Stephen Thatcher, Joyce Thatcher and Herbert Thatcher II. Family and friends will be received on Thursday, January 28, 2016, from 4-6pm at Quattlebaum's Funeral Home, 6411 Parker Avenue, West Pam Beach, FL. Funeral Liturgy with Mass will be celebrated on Friday, January 29, 2016 at 11am at St. Edward's Catholic Church, 144 North County Road, Palm Beach. A reception in her honor at the Everglades Club will follow. Entombment will be at a later date at the convenience of the family. Memorial contributions may be made to a charity of your choice. 1/3

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  MISSETT, BARBARA THATCHER
